intro: Lampranthus laetus, commonly known as the yellow firecracker, is a strikingly colorful plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright orange to yellow tubular flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Lampranthus laetus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a popular choice in rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
